content: Am I the only one getting an error on 5th testcase and validator ? Seems like swapping "&" and "%" in the character list does the trick... I don't know why but there might be an error in the testcases... Or my code is just weird

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting and unique task! Just one suggestion: specify in the description that even if bishop does not move (he is stuck in the corner) we should increment counter for that corner cell.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is fun

Hi,

It doesn't seems that any of 4 cases where you are in a corner and you can't slide is tested in any of the tests/validators. 
I was also wondering if in these cases you would update the count of how many times the corner was visited of not.

I'm a bit conflicted about this puzzle, I almost want to say it should be in the easy category :D

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Both fun and instructive, I enjoyed it.

Another very nice puzzle, thanks Eulero314!

Am I wrong or the test cases use '0' (zero) and not the character 'O'  from BOX?

Goal section
* Suggest to use the Unicode arrow characters instead of ^\ etc (e.g. ↖). The monospace format makes these arrows too small to see, though; better not to format if you include the Unicode characters.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arrow_(symbol)#Unicode

* Suggest to change the paragraph "The following example shows (etc)" to:
During the 64 steps of the algorithm, the bit pairs are processed byte-wise, from left to right and least significant bits first.

Example: The fingerprint {{FC:94}} means the following steps:

* Suggest to add a blank line before "At the end of the 64 steps".

* Suggest to change "(Over index 14 restart from index 0)." to:
We apply the wrap-around logic if the number of times visited is greater than 14, e.g. we use {{o}} if a position is visited for 17 times.

* Please change "respecting" to "respective".

* Please change "top and bottom" to "top and bottom edges".

* Please change "| for edges" to "| for left and right edges".

* Please change "top frame" to "top edge".

Input section
* An example is not needed here, as one example is shown below the Constraints section.

Output section
* Please add <<11 lines:>> to the front.

Constraints section
* Suggest to mention that there are always exactly 64 steps that can be produced by the input string.

* Is it possible that the bishop ends up at a corner and cannot slide at all? For example, what if the bishop is at the upper right corner and the next move is 01? If this is not tested/not possible, please mention it in this section.

Thanks.
Wow, I didn't expect the Unicode arrow to show up in green in the comments...
Thanks! I copy pasted from www.jfurness.uk but it seems to be wrong. BOX is correct. I'll fix my code and test/val soon.

Thanks for your comment! 
I added a test for corner case (see if it answer your question) and move the puzzle to easy category.
let me know!

Hi, the 5th test case verify this situation:
"If the Bishop ends up at a corner and he cannot slide, he simply does not move (and we should increment counter for that corner cell). "
The '%' position is visited 25 times.
I checked the implementations of the others and they all pass the test. 
Let me know if this helps.
Yes, it was actually my fault, I thought there were only 14 characters. Only one testcase tests the full character cycle

Well I wasn't pushing that hard to have it move to the easy category, I would be fine with either of them. 
I'd love to hear what others think about the difficulty.
I think I fixed everything and clarified some points, Thanks as always for the support.
